newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: Salim says Sierra Leone coup must be reversed.
newsitem.headline: Salim says Sierra Leone coup must be reversed.

text.p: Organisation of African Unity Secretary-General Salim Ahmed Salim said on Monday "everything" should be done to reverse a coup in Sierra Leone.
His remarks appeared to be an endorsement of military efforts by West African states to reinstate President Ahmad Tejan Kabbah.
Speaking at the start of a three-day OAU summit, Salim -- who has already condemned the Sierra Leone coup -- said the coup was an unacceptable challenge to Africa's progress towards democracy.
"In the interest of Sierra Leone and Africa as a whole, everything must be done to restore constitutional legality in that country," he said.

Kabbah was overthrown by junior military officers eight days ago and West African states, led by Nigeria, on Monday appeared to be carrying out their threat to use military force to restore him to office.
